home.about_description: Vihara Avalokitesvara Pondok Cabe is a Buddhayana temple under the Sangha Agung Indonesia, serving the community since the early 1980s. Located on Jalan Pondok Cabe Raya in Pamulang, South Tangerang, it hosts weekly Sunday services, meditation sessions, and programs for the youth (PMV) and children (GABI).

about.title: About the Temple
about.subtitle: Temple profile, vision & mission, brief history, and leadership information.

profile.title: Profile, Vision & Mission
profile.description: Avalokitesvara Temple is a place for spiritual cultivation and service—where the community learns the Dhamma, practices virtue, and strengthens harmony in a calm and orderly atmosphere.
profile.vision_text: To be a temple that nurtures wisdom, compassion, and harmony—serving as a welcoming center for Dhamma education and community growth.
mission_items: Conduct regular services, meditation sessions, and Dhamma learning.
Encourage character development, discipline, and social care within the community.
Provide engaging learning spaces for children and youth.
Cultivate a culture of service (seva) through committees and social programs.

timeline.text: The community began organizing simple worship and Dhamma learning activities, gradually growing as the need for a dedicated place of practice increased.
Regular programs became more structured; youth and children initiatives were strengthened to support long-term cultivation.
The temple continues to serve through religious activities, Dhamma education, and community service—grounded in harmony and consistency.

pmv.desc_full: The Temple Youth Association focuses on Dhamma learning, character and leadership development, and service through temple committees and social activities.

gabi.desc_full: The Indonesian Buddhist Children Group is a Sunday School program for Buddhist children at the temple. Children learn Buddhist values in a fun way through Dhamma stories, simple chanting, educational games, and creative activities.
